        public FileCollector​(java.util.Map<javax0.geci.api.Source.Set,​java.lang.String[]> directories)

    • Method Detail

      • collect

        public void collect()
        Collect the names of the files that are in the directories given in the sources. Also modify the global directories map so that for each Source.Set key in the map there will be only a one element array containing the name of the directory that was used to collect the files.

      • addNewSource

        public void addNewSource​(Source source)

      • normalize

        public static java.lang.String normalize​(java.lang.String s)
        Normalize a file name. Convert all \ separator to / and remove all '/./' path parts.
        Parameters:
        s - the not yet normalized file name
        Returns:
        the file directory name

      • calculateClassName

        public static java.lang.String calculateClassName​(java.lang.String directory,
                                                  java.nio.file.Path path)
        Calculate the class name.
        Parameters:
        directory - as a reference
        path - points to the source file
        Returns:
        the name of the class calculated from the file name

      • calculateRelativeName

        public static java.lang.String calculateRelativeName​(java.lang.String directory,
                                                     java.nio.file.Path path)
        Calculate the relative file name, relative to the start point of the source set.
        Parameters:
        directory - the starting, top level directory of the source set
        path - the path in the source set
        Returns:
        the relative file name

      • toAbsolute

        public static java.lang.String toAbsolute​(java.nio.file.Path path)
        Convert the path to absolute path and also normalize off some weird stuff that may remain after applying the JDK methods (e.g.: /./ inside the path)
        Parameters:
        path - to convert to absolute path string
        Returns:
        the absolute path as a string
